description: Barack Obama made four visits to Saudi Arabia;
title: Donald Trump and Barack Obama on the Arab world - how do they differ?

author: http://xml.zeit.de/autoren/T/Wolfgang_Thielmann/index
description: Barack Obama und Angela Merkel werden die Stars auf dem Kirchentag sein, ihr Auftritt findet parallel zu einer AfD-Debatte statt. Die Nähe zur Politik hat Tradition.
title: Barack Obama: Wie viel Politik ist gut für den Kirchentag?

author: http://xml.zeit.de/autoren/N/Matthias_Nass/index.xml
description: Auf dem Kirchentag in Berlin werden Barack Obama wieder die Herzen zufliegen. Wie sollte es auch anders sein, bei diesem Nachfolger im Weißen Haus?
title: Barack Obama beim Kirchentag: Botschafter eines anderen Amerikas

author: Jack Moore
description: The Jerusalem hotel has previously hosted Barack Obama and Vladimir Putin.
title: Inside Donald Trump’s stay at Israel’s King David Hotel: Robots, rocket-proof glass and a $100m price tag

author: Christoph von Marschall
description: Barack Obama kann Menschen anrühren wie ein Pfarrer. Seine Religiosität wurde ihm nicht in die Wiege gelegt. Zum christlichen Glauben fand er in Chicagos Armenvierteln.
title: Präsidialer Prediger

author: KEN THOMAS and JILL COLVIN
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As a presidential candidate, Donald Trump railed against President Barack Obama for failing to utter the words "radical Islamic terrorism." He accused the foundation run by Bill and Hillary Clinton of corruption for accepting charitable contributions from Saudi Arabia and chastised first lady Michelle Obama for not covering her head during a visit to the Kingdom. Now that he's president, Trump has changed his tune. The president now finds himself adjusting to the nuances of Middle East diplomacy, where inflammatory campaign slogans — no matter how popular among some voters — can be the cause of major disruptions now that he holds office.
title: Contradictions add up during Trump's Saudi visit

author: DAN PERRY
description: JERUSALEM (AP) — President Donald Trump showered his Middle Eastern hosts with praise and declared a breakthrough regional peace within reach. No one contradicted him, but behind the pageantry and politesse a wall of skepticism remains solidly intact. It's often said that the contours of Israeli-Palestinian peace are well-known. And as Trump professed, much of the Arab world does seem ready to normalize relations with the Jewish state. But the obstacles that bedeviled industrious outside brokers for decades — including Barack Obama and John Kerry — have not been removed.
title: Trump touts ultimate peace, but same obstacles remain

author: ALAN FRAM and RICARDO ALONSO-ZALDIVAR
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The health care bill Republicans have pushed through the House would leave 23 million additional people uninsured in 2026 compared to President Barack Obama's health care law, the Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday. The GOP bill would lower average premiums, but in part that would be because coverage would typically be skimpier. In a blow to Republicans, the nonpartisan analysts were also critical of 11th-hour provisions that GOP leaders had added to pick up votes and assure the bill's passage. Letting states get federal waivers so insurers could charge higher premiums for people with pre-existing medical conditions would mean those consumers would "ultimately be unable to purchase" comprehensive coverage at prices comparable to today's costs, "if they could purchase at all."
title: House GOP health bill projection: 23 million more uninsured
